relatedanime.anime: Digimon Adventure: Bokura no War Game!

recommendations.recommendation: Japanese version, that is. Pretty disgusting what was done in the dub.
A classic anime for me with a fantastic story and awesome soundtrack.
Ah, nostalgia is killing me. Damn, this was one of the first animes I saw. Awesomeness.

anime.description: Seven kids at summer camp are unexpectedly transported by digivices to a colorful and enigmatic world. Lost and alone, they are befriended by small digital monsters, Digimons. The kids and their Digimon partners quickly become inseparable, and the little creatures guide their human friends through the wondrous DigiWorld, protecting them from the hordes of evil Digimons. The group soon discovers that some of the giant Digimons they encounter are not evil Digimons but good Digimons gone bad. A dark power is corrupting even the most gentle of Digimons by embedding Black Gears into them, turning them into vicious monsters. Creating chaos and destruction wherever it goes, the evil power threatens all of DigiWorld. As they try to find their way back home, the seven kids are drawn further and further into the mystery. Through teamwork and trust, they help their newfound Digimon friends digivolve from "monsters in training" to giant champions that must save the DigiWorld from the powerful evil intent on destroying it.

externalentity.identifier: デジモンアドベンチャー

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: parallel world
tag.description: A parallel world, parallel universe, or alternative reality is a self-contained separate reality coexisting with our own. Because "alternative reality" sometimes implies that the reality is a variant of our own, like for example a mirror world, we use the term "parallel world/universe" which is more general, without any connotations implying a relationship (or lack thereof) with our own world/universe (meaning a fictional world can just as well have an alternative reality, it doesn`t need to be our reality). To put it more simply, this category is to show if more than 1 world/universe/reality is present in the anime. Multiple timelines of the same world/universe/reality are NOT considered parallel worlds. For example, in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate] the cast travels through multiple "World Lines", which are defined as parallel timelines of the same universe had various events occurred with differing outcomes.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: evolution
tag.description: Evolution is change in the heritable characteristics of biological populations over successive generations. Evolutionary processes give rise to biodiversity at every level of biological organisation, including the levels of species, individual organisms, and molecules. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: Robinson Crusoe
tag.description: Literary classic about a man marooned on a distant island.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: merchandising show
tag.description: The bane of the parent`s wallet; this show usually has only a single reason for existence: to advertise the toy line it is based upon to the intended target audience. The variety of toys can range from accessories for girls and boys, to cards and figures or models. Most often the ability of the toys will be exaggerated or invokes magic to work in the anime. The toys`s names will also be continuously repeated in the anime, often accompanied by flashy effects and loud shouting. Combined with an intricate story that typically involves an adventure or a tournament of sorts, it makes for an effective commercial.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: life force
tag.description: Life force exists in many forms and is known under many names. It is the invisible fuel that runs human bodies and is resistent against scientific research and explanation. However, this very energy is one of the most powerful forces in the universe. Especially in mahou shoujo anime, the big bad evil will always try to steal it for their plans, bad guys from outer space will need it as food and even the good guys will often use their life force to bring back dead to life again, eventually sacrificing their life in the course of such an event. Other energy sources known to mankind are the power of love and the power of friendship.

tag.name: fate worse than death
tag.description: If you think death is the worst that can ever happen to someone, you had better think again: at least one character in this show is sure to end up in such a terrible way that many people would likely have preferred death if they had the choice. The fate of such characters is normally not for the faint of heart, and the audience is expected to at least sympathise with the poor character`s fate, and at times even be horrified at the shocking turn of events that led to their demise.

tag.name: survival
tag.description: The theme/genre of survival typically depicts the act or process of continuing to live, generally in a hostile, possibly post-apocalyptic environment. Survival-centered media tends to be dark, set most commonly in a contemporary context, and generally leads either to small groups of people forming closely knit and functional units or to individuals turning against their fellows in a return to the survival of the fittest.

tag.name: children of destiny
tag.description: In case of nearing doomsday leave all the military equipment to kids — they will save the day. Rejoice!

tag.name: social commentary
tag.description:
Social commentary is the act of rebelling against an individual, or a group of people by rhetorical means. This is most often done with the idea of implementing or promoting change by informing the general populace about a given problem and appealing to people’s sense of justice. (Source: Wikipedia)
Since this is anime, usually, the mores of Japan and the Japanese society are scrutinised, but not restricted to that.

tag.name: dreams and reality
tag.description: This genre of anime is typically set in both the world as we know it (reality) and a world of dreams, mythology or imagination. Sometimes this dreamworld is actually real, sometimes it is not. Other times what we think is the real world is the dreamworld, and vice versa. They are not always easy to distinguish from each other, neither by the characters nor the viewer. Whatever is real, and whatever is reality, both worlds are integral in shaping both the plot of this anime and the development of the characters.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: call my name
tag.description: "TETSUOOOOOO!!" "KANEDAAAAAA!!" "TAMAHOMEEEE!!" "MIAKAAAA!!" Feelings of any kind towards other characters are best shown by calling each other`s name, loud, REALLY LOUD. For better effect at least twice or thrice. For lover`s couples and mortal enemies it is a requirement to run towards each other while calling each other`s name, unaware of the surroundings.

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: isekai
tag.description:
An isekai story is one in which the lead characters are transferred to and become stuck or trapped in another world, one completely different from the one they lived in up until the transfer. The new world is commonly a http://anidb.net/t2628 [fictional world], such as a http://anidb.net/t2838 [parallel world] or http://anidb.net/t2839 [virtual world] (other fictional world types can also apply). What defines the isekai genre is that the characters are sent to another world, often but not always a parallel one, and they generally cannot come back permanently without meeting a highly specific goal. In order to adapt to their new environment, they must use the abilities and knowledge brought from their former world as well as any that may have been bestowed upon them by their brave new world. In some cases, they will seek and eventually find a way to return; in others, they will gleefully embrace their new life. http://anidb.net/a144 [Inuyasha] is an example where isekai applies to a fictional world that is not also a parallel or virtual world. http://anidb.net/ch7246 [Higurashi Kagome] climbs down an ancient well at her grandfather`s shrine and is transported to feudal Japan (time travel). While she eventually gains the physical ability to travel back and forth between her time period and feudal Japan, her bonds and responsibilities to feudal Japan tie her there until they are ultimately resolved. For clarity, below is an illustrative example where isekai is applied to a non-fictional, non-parallel, non-virtual world.
* The main characters are from Earth. One day, they are abducted by Nazis from Mars (alternate "world") are brought back to their Martian base. The main characters are trapped on Mars. Their only escape is to defeat the Nazis and steal their spaceship to return to Earth (specific goal required to escape); they are left to thier own devices, with no prospect of help from Earth, and no way to contact Earth.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: お台場の妖精! リリモン開花
Flower Power
Die Nebelwand
La grande panne
Síla květin
Odaiba no Yousei! Lilimon Kaika
episode.summary: Myotismon has created a fog that is covering the city of Odaiba, while looking for the eighth child he tells Phantomon to capture everyone in the city. Soon everyone is being held in the Civic Center, including Sora and Mimi. Tai and Matt are caught in the fog, but have not yet been found by the evil digimon. Meanwhile, Joe and T.K. are caught outside the city and are trying to figure out how to get through the fog and back into Odaiba. The people in Odaiba are attacked by DarkTryannomon and Togemon digivolves all the way to the most powerful level, Lillymon, who takes care of the problem. Lillymon goes off to battle Myotismon alone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の城ヴァンデモン
The Gateway to Home
Das Tor zur Welt
De fameuses recrues
Brána domů
Yami no Shiro Vamdemon
episode.summary: Gennai again appears and tells the kids that there is an eighth DigiDestioned and that Myotismon is planning to go to the Real World with an army of evil Digimon to find him/her. The kids infiltrate Myotismon`s castle in an attempt to stop him from opening a gate that will allow him access to the Real World, but fail when Gatomon animates a series of Devidramon statues. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蒼き狼! ガルルモン
Garurumon
Nächtliches Abenteuer
Le loup bleu
O Nascimento de Garurumon
Modrý vlk Garurumon
Aoki Ookami! Garurumon
episode.summary: The kids run away from a Monochromon battle. They come across a trolley car on a small island and decide to spend the night in it, until they are attacked by a Seadramon. Gabumon eventually digivolves into Garurumon and defeats Seadramon. Then they leave the island to find land. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 爆撃指令! ムゲンドラモン
My Sister`s Keeper
Plan Z
Une petite sœur fragile
Kari je nemocná
Bakugeki Shirei! MugenDramon
episode.summary: The kids are crossing yet another desert, but Kari gets sick and passes out. Tai gets really upset and soon Tai tells the others that Kari almost died once. When Tai and Kari were younger, Kari was sick at home and Tai was to be keeping an eye on her. Thinking of only himself, he took her outside just so he could play with his friends. Kari ended up in the hospital for a while as a result of not being kept indoors. After knowing this, the kids look for a hospital in the Digital World to take Kari or a place that has medicine to help her. Kabuterimon takes them to a deserted city where Kari can rest, but they still need to find medicine for her. Using the internet, Izzy locates a place where they can get the medicine. He soon realizes that the evil Digimon are able to find them whenever he uses his computer on a network. Soon, the bad guys are all over and Izzy tries to throw them off by using the computer again. The grab the medicine and return to where Kari and the others were...but they arrive just in time to see the building be destroyed by a missile. It turns out that the other kids got out just before the missile arrived. The others are chased into another building which crumbles in on top of them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の使者デビモン!
Evil Shows His Face
Der Herr der Dunkelheit
Le village du diable
Tvář zla
Yami no Shisha Devimon!
episode.summary: The kids meet the ruler of File Island, Devimon, the controller of the Black Gears. He, along with Ogremon and a possessed Leomon, attack the kids who manage to escape. They end up in a mysterious mansion, which proves to be a hallucination created by Devimon. Devimon breaks File Island into multiple, smaller islands and separates the kids onto the different islands. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 結界突破! ズドモンスパーク!
City Under Siege
Eine schwere Entscheidung
La ville assiégée
Město pod palbou
Kekkai Toppa! Zudomon Spark!
episode.summary: Tai goes to find his parents and to free the people at the convention center. Izzy receives an email from Gennai telling him how to set up a program on his computer that will stop the evil digimon from finding them. This program ends up saving Tai and his parents. MegaSeadramon attacks Joe and T.K., but Ikkakumon digivolves into Zudomon and defeats the monster. They find Wizardmon in the water with the eighth child`s crest. Phantomon shows up and calls two other digimon to attack Sora and Matt. Kari thinks that if she gives herself up to Myotismon, Phantomon will leave them alone, so she gives herself up and Phantomon carries her off. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 沈黙の海底ホエーモン
Under Pressure
Whamon, mein Held
Sous pression
Chinmoku no Kaitei Whamon
episode.summary: Just when it looks like it is about over for the kids and their digimon, Whamon shows up to rescue them. Soon after their escape, the Divermon are sent out to look for them. While checking over his computer, Izzy discovers that WarGreymon has the ability to destroy Dramon type Digimon. The Divermon find the kids and attack Whamon, but when Whamon dives down quickly, the Divermon can`t follow him because they can`t handle the pressure change. Izzy uses his computer to find a tunnel that leads to a safe place...for a while that is. Soon MetalSeadramon finds them and Whamon rushes to the surface and ends up in a bay. When MetalSeadramon attacks, Agumon and WarGreymon WarpDigivolve and prepare for battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱いぜ東京タワー! デスメラモン
Gatomon Comes Calling
Kari in Gefahr
Gatomon en renfort
Gatomon na návštěvě
Atsui Ze Tokyo Tower! DeathMeramon
episode.summary: Tai and the others are looking for the Shibaura area of the city, the search is still on before Myotismon finds the eighth child. Gatomon finds Kari in the park and thinks that she is the eighth child because she did know who Agumon was. Mimi and Sora decide to look for the eighth child in a tower, but once up in the tower, they are attacked by SkullMeramon. Agumon digivolves into Greymon and then to MetalGreymon before he finally is able to beat SkullMeramon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の暗黒デジモン
Now Apocalymon [a.k.a. Apocalymon Now]
Ein neuer Feind
Au tour d`Apocalymon
Saigo no Ankoku Digimon
episode.summary: What is left of Spiral Mountain begains to fall apart and the kids soon find themselves floating in darkness. Gennai tells the kids that the evil force that made the DarkMasters came from the fire wall. This evil force walked across the fire wall and threatened the end of the Digital World. There were other DigiDestined children who had defeated this evil before. Tai and the others where choosen because a new evil had come to the DigiWorld from behind the firewall. It was said that the DigiWorld would be put into darkness, this is where the kids are floating right now. Gennai gets cut off before he has a chance to tell the kids the name of the evil force. Soon the new evil appears, Apocalymon, who has all of the attacks of the DarkMasters combined. Aploycomon destroys all of the kids crests to stop the Digimon from digivolving. The kids are then sent to the "Data World" where all computer information comes from. The kids finally realize just how inprotant each of them really are to the DigiWorld, this then restores the power of their crests and they return to the "Non-Data World". This is it, now only the finally battle remains...Stay Tuned for next time… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活! 魔王ヴェノムヴァンデモン
Prophecy
Alle gegen VenomMyotismon
La prophétie
Věštba
Fukkatsu! Maou VenomVamdemon
episode.summary: Gennai finds a prophecy that could help the kids defeat Myotismon once and for all and restore both worlds. After the kids finally figure out what the prophecy means, they quickly figure out that parts of it are coming true. Bats appear in the sky, the people of Odaiba chant Myotismon`s name, and Myotismon returns to his "True" form. Gatomon digivolves into Angewomon. This would make the last part of the Prophecy come true, Angels shoot arrows of light. Angemon and Angewomon shoot arrows at Tai and Matt, this makes Agumon and Gabumon Warp-Digivolve into their ultimate levels. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 聖剣士! ホーリーエンジェモン
Piedmon`s Last Jest
Meister der Dunkelheit
Le dernier tour de Piedmon
Seikenshi! HolyAngemon
episode.summary: Piedmon starts to get very upset when the Digimon try to fight him and actually starts turning the kids and Digimon into keychains. Everyone is captured except for Kari and T.K. T.K. calls for Angemon and Angemon digivolves into MagnaAngemon and saves the two kids. MangaAngemon gets back all the keycains and returns everyone to normal. Piedmon attacks with an army of Vilemon and at the save time, Mimi arrives with an army of Digimon. Soon the evil forces and Piedmon are defeated. They kids think they have won, but Gennai sends them an email that tells them that the DarkMasters were not the real evil force in the DigiWorld. There is an other evil force that created the DarkMasters. The kids will still have to face this TRUE evil force latter on. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 爆裂進化! グレイモン
The Birth of Greymon
Greymons Geburt
La naissance de Greymon
O Nascimento de Greymon
Zrození Greymona
Bakuretsu Shinka! Greymon
episode.summary: The kids come across a beach with numerous phone booths, but none of them seem to work. As they sit down for a break to eat, a wild Shellmon appears and attacks the kids. Agumon digivolves into Greymon and blasts him away into the ocean. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ささやく小悪魔ピコデビモン
Forget About It!
Nichts als Lügen
Les champignons de l`oubli
Zapomeň na to
Sasayaku Koakuma PicoDevimon
episode.summary: Tai and Agumon return to the Digital World to find Tokomon. Tokomon relays what has happened in the time that they have been gone (which is several weeks in DigiWorld time). He reveals that the entire group has separated and that DemiDevimon has tricked T.K. into becoming his "friend." T.K. realizes DemiDevimon`s trickery after Agumon exposes him for a fraud. Tokomon digivolves into Patamon and drives DemiDevimon away. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灼熱! バードラモン
Biyomon Gets Firepower
Im Dorf der Yokomon
Tout feu, tout flamme
A Sora em Perigo
Shakunetsu! Birdramon
episode.summary: The kids come to a Yokomon village to rest for the evening. A Meramon attacks the village and Biyomon digivolves to Birdramon to defeat him, causing a Black Gear to be expelled from his body. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 眠れる暴君! トノサマゲコモン
Princess Karaoke
Prinzessin Karaoke
Une méchante princesse
Princezna Caruso
Nemureru Boukun! TonosamaGeckomon
episode.summary: Joe and Tai find Mimi being treated like a princess at a palace. Sora convinces her to sing and awaken ShogunGekomom, but ShogunGekomom attacks the kids. MetalGreymon manages to defeat him and Mimi apologizes for her behavior. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 完全体進化! メタルグレイモン
The Earthquake of Metalgreymon
Bewährungsprobe
Un véritable séisme
Zachraňte Soru
Kanzentai Shinka! MetalGreymon
episode.summary: Tai manages to rescue Sora. Datamon pulls himself, Etemon, and many of Etemon`s minions directly into the Dark Network. When Etemon reappears, having fused with the network, Greymon digivolves into MetalGreymon to fight him. The battle ends up opening a portal that sucks away Etemon and transports both Tai and Agumon back to Tokyo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 荒ぶる海の王! メタルシードラモン
Sea-Sick and Tired
Seadramons Rache
Une grosse fatigue
Araburu Umi no Ou! MetalSeadramon
episode.summary: While trying to save the digidestined from Piedmon, Piximon is destroyed. The kids suddenly find themselves back in the DigiWorld, on the edge of the beach. They soon realize that this is the same spot where they spent their first night in the DigiWorld. Shellmon suddenly attacks them, but the digimon quickly take care of the problem. MetalSeadramon sends Scorpiomon after them. Scorpiomon traps the kids in a building where he almost barbecues the kids. They are only saved when Togemon and Ikkakumon digivolve into mega. The kids then hurry to get away, but get trapped in the middle of the ocean. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さらばヌメモン
The Crest of Light
Wieder vereint
La force de la lumière
Saraba Numemon
episode.summary: As the building caves in on them, the kids fall into the sewers under the city. Tai and Izzy have the medicine for Kari and are searching for them. Sora, Biyomon, and Patamon find Kari, T.K. and Gatomon. Kari`s fever finally breaks and she wakes up, feeling a little better than before. The group continue to search for Tai and Izzy but run into a group of WaruMonzaemon. The stange light that took over Kari before returns and helps make the Digimon stronger than ever before. The group defeats the evil Digimon and free some enslaved Numomon. While the kids follow that light, Machinedramon arrives and battles the WarMonzaemon. Still looking for Kari and the others, Tai and Izzy run into Andromon and are attacked by Machinedramon, after all of this, the two groups of kids finally meet up. Kari`s "light" gives WarGreymon all the power he needs to finally defeat Machinedramon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マンモン光が丘大激突!
Return to Highton View Terrace
Der erste Kampf der Digimon
Retour en ville
Zpět na Hightonské terasy
Mammon Hikarigaoka Daigekitotsu!
episode.summary: The DigiDestined return to their original camp and then head to Highton View Terrace trying to find the eighth child. There, a battle between Garudamon and Mammothmon helps them all recall how they witnessed a battle four years earlier between a Greymon and a Parrotmon. This leads them to surmise that the eighth child must have also seen the fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女の闘い! レディデビモン
Joe`s Battle
LadyDavimon
Le combat de Joe
Onna no Tatakai! LadyDevimon
episode.summary: The kids again split into two groups to prepare for battle with the final Dark Master. Tai and his group are attacked by LadyDevimon. Tai tells Sora and T.K. to find the others (Joe and Mimi). Joe and Mini find Elecmon in the now destroyed Primery Village and joins them on the quest for the final battle. Joe and Gomamon decide to go off by themselves for a while to see if they can find their own place in the world. With the help of WarGreymon, Tai and the rest of his group defeat LadyDevimon. Shortly after they defeated LadyDevimon, the last DarkMaster, Piedmon appears. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 電光! カブテリモン
Kabuterimon`s Electro Shocker
Die geheimnisvolle Fabrik
Le faux androïde
Kabuterimon
Denkou! Kabuterimon
episode.summary: The kids stumble upon a strange factory where they find an Andromon caught in the machinery. After they release him he attacks them. Izzy discovers strange coding, which he uses to digivolve Tentomon into Kabuterimon. Kabuterimon destroys the Black Gear controlling Andromon. Apologizing for his behavior, Andromon shows the children out of the factory. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追撃! 日本へ急げ
It`s All in the Cards
Sesam öffne dich
La bonne carte
Karetní úloha
Tsuigeki! Nippon e Isoge
episode.summary: The group travels to Gennai`s home where he unravels some secrets about the Digital World. When the kids return to the castle to open the gate, they battle with Dokugumon. Even though the castle is destroyed in the fight, they still manage to open the gateway. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パンプとゴツは渋谷系デジモン
Out on the Town
Freunde für einen kurzen Moment
À travers la ville
Výlet do města
Pump to Gotsu wa Shibuyakei Digimon
episode.summary: Matt is taking T.K. home on the train, Patamon thinks it was nice that Matt and T.K. where able to spend some time together since their parents are seperated and the two brothers don`t live together. T.K. overhears Patamon saying this to the other digimon and thinks Patamon is making fun of them. After that, Patamon leaves the train and Matt and T.K. go to look for him. While looking for Patamon, they run into Pumpkinmon and Gotsumon. Myotismon shows up and when the two refuse to attack the kids, he blasts them back to the DigitalWorld. T.K. thinks it`s all his fault that all of this has happened. When Patamon sences that T.K. is upset, he digivolves into Angemon and returns to Matt and T.K. The search for the eighth child now continues… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔の山の四天王! ダークマスターズ
Enter the Dark Masters
Rückkehr in die DigiWelt
Les maîtres de l`ombre
Ma no Yama no Shitennou! Dark Masters
episode.summary: The kids and their Digimon find themselves back in the Digiworld. Shortly after coming back, Kari finds Chuumon, a mouse-like digimon, who tells them that a lot of time has passed since they left and now the four Dark Masters have moved the DigiWorld to Spiral Mountain and are planning to take it over. MetalSeadramon shows up but the kids and Digimon are able to escape, they are unable to defeat him because he is an untimate level Digimon. The next Dark Master, Puppetmon, controls the kids and Digimon with strings and drops them off to see the fourth Dark Master, Piedmon. Piximon shows up at the last second and rescues them. The third Dark Master is Unknown at this time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 究極体激突! ウォーグレイモンVSメタルガルルモン
The Ultimate Clash
Bilder aus der Vergangenheit
La dernière dispute
Kyuukyokutai Gekitotsu! WarGreymon VS MetalGarurumon
episode.summary: Matt doesn`t understand why they have to be in the DigitalWorld and we wants to leave RIGHT NOW! (Yes, he has BIG issues right now) MetalGarurumon and WarGreymon battle while Matt and Tai have a fist fight. This was Puppertmon`s plan all along, to get all the DigiDestined to destroy each other. A strange light suddenly appears and takes over Kari`s body. The kids find themselves flying through the air and are surrounded by computer images from the past. They learn that the crests represent the best quality each of them had four years ago. Finally, they are told how and why each of them where chosen to be a DigiDestined. If any of the kid`s special quality is ever lost, that child`s Digimon can no longer Digivolve. After that was all over, Kari returned to normal, but was very weak and tired. Matt still wants to be alone and leaves again. Mimi doesn`t want to go on with the goup either and stays behind too. Joe doesn`t think that Mimi will be safe by herself and stays with her. They rest of the group go on their way...once again leaving the group split up again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たな世界
The Fate of Two Worlds
Abschied ohne Wiedersehen?
Le sort des deux mondes
Arata na Sekai
episode.summary: Apocalymon launches the "Total Annihilation" attack, the power within the kids causes their digivices to contain the blast and return it back at full force onto Apocalymon and with that the final battle is over. Gennai shows up and tells the kids that the DigiWorld will now start over, starting with File Island. The DigiWorld begins to return to normal and the kids go back to File Island. They decide they will stay in the DigiWorld the rest of the summer since time on Earth is so much slower than the DigiWorld. However, Gennai explains that after Apocalymon was destroyed time in the real world and the DigiWorld became equal, so now time travels at the same rate in both worlds. The only way for the kids to get home is through a portal that will close in two hours. Each of the kids must say goodbye to their Digimon partners. However, as they are leaving, T.K. and Kari somehow seem to know that they will see each other again someday. Tai says that he will never forget the digimon and wonders if they will remember him when or if they meet again!!! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の絆! テイルモン
The Eighth Child Revealed
Endlich gefunden
L`arrivée du huitième enfant
Osmá digivyvolená je na světě
Unmei no Kizuna! Tailmon
episode.summary: Gatomon is watching Kari from the roof of a nearby building, she still isn`t sure if Kari is the eighth child or not. Wizardmon finds the eighth digivice in the crows nest. DemiDevimon shows up with Wizardmon and ask what he has found. Wizardmon says that he has found nothing and then takes the digivice to Gatomon. With the digivice, Gatomon suddenly remembers that she has been looking for Kari all of her life. Agumon sees Kari talking to Gatomon and attacks her, not knowing that she and Kari know each other. Agumon`s attack is a miss, and Gatomon protects Kari from the blast. Gatomon then reveals to Tai and Kari that she is Kari`s digimon and Kari is the eighth digidestined. Myotismon shows up and takes Gatomon away, he knows Gatomon is good and may be able to help him find that eighth child. If he only knew how close he was. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迷いの森のジュレイモン
Trash Day
Cherrymons Intrige
Une journée salissante
Mayoi no Mori no Jureimon
episode.summary: Tai and everyone else gose off to look for Matt. Matt is not really sure why he is a DigiDestined and gets upset that the others are getting stronger and better then he is (or so he thinks..he`s sort of loosing is mind at this point..oh, sorry). Anyway, a tree-like Digimon called Cherrymon, tells him that he must be the leader and in order to be the leader, he must destroy Tai. Puppetmon and Garbagemon attack the others. The kids are having problems with the battle, until Matt shows up with MetalGarurumon and blast away the Garbagemon. Then, as if things weren`t bad enough, MetalGarurumon turns on Agumon (at Matt`s decision) and challenges him to a fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 咆哮! イッカクモン
Ikkakumon`s Harpoon Torpedo
Gomamons Verwandlung
La torpille-harpon
Ikkakumonova pomsta
Houkou! Ikkakumon
episode.summary: Tai and Matt argue whether they should climb Infinity Mountain. Joe and Gomamon decide to climb the mountain by themselves. While on the mountain, they are attacked by a Unimon. Tai and Sora come to the rescue, and Gomamon digivolves into Ikkakumon and destroys the Black Gear that was controlling Unimon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妖精! ピッコロモン
The Piximon Cometh
Schule des Lebens
Bravo Piximon
Piximonův trénink
Yousei! Piccolomon
episode.summary: The group is attacked by a Kuwagamon and Tai fails to digivolve Agumon. Piximon intervenes and saves them. He then offers the group training at his facility, and leads Agumon and Tai into a cave while the others stay outside. When Matt finds his Crest of Friendship and Izzy finds his Crest of Knowledge, they are spotted and attacked by Tyrannomon. Tai and Agumon reappear just in time to defeat Tyrannomon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迷宮のナノモン!
The Prisoner of the Pyramid
Der Gefangene in der Pyramide
Le prisonnier de la pyramide
Zajatec v pyramidě
Meikyuu no Nanomon!
episode.summary: The discovery of T.K.`s Crest of Hope reveals a cave engraved with Digi-code. Izzy receives an e-mail from Datamon asking for help from within Etemon`s headquarters, which is a large upside down pyramid. Datamon promises them that if they free him, he will show them Sora`s Crest. After he is freed, however, he escapes and kidnaps Sora. He intends on making a copy of her so that he can control Biyomon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風よ!光よ! サーベルレオモン
Ogremon`s Honor
Die Stadt des ewigen Anfangs
L`honneur d`Ogremon
Kaze yo! Hikari yo! SaberLeomon
episode.summary: Mimi and Joe find SaberLeomon, the Digivolved form of Leomon. SaberLeomon takes Joe and Mimi to a safe place where they meet with Otamamon and Gekomon. Puppetmon tells the other kids to follow him is they want to defeat him. They follow him, but he leads them to a group of Red Vegiemon, but they are no match for the kids and digimon. An angered Puppetmon makes his house come to life in an attempt to crush the kids. Leomon digivolves back into SaberLeomon and fights MetalEtemon. Ikkakumon digivolves into Zudomon to help in the battle. Puppetmon tries to get MetalGarurumon to attack the kids like before, but instead, he destroys Puppetmon. Just before Puppetmon disappears for good, he is told that the kids have friends and he doesn`t, so he could have never won the battle. Leomon is defeated and is gone. Joe, Mimi, and Ogremon say that they WILL defeat the Dark Masters…or what`s left of them anyway. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漂流? 冒険の島!
And So It Begins...
So fing alles an
Comment tout a commencé...
Férias de Verão
Jak to všechno začalo
Hyouryuu? Bouken no Shima!
episode.summary: While at summer camp, seven kids, Tai, Matt, Sora, Izzy, Mimi, Joe, and T.K., come across seven Digivices and are transported to a strange "Digital World". In this new world they make friends with little creatures that call themselves "Digimon"—short for Digital Monsters—who claim to be the children’s chosen partners. The seven "Digimon" prove to the kids that they are who they say they are when they digivolve—get much bigger, evolving into a different Digital Monster—and fight as a team to defeat a large, red beetle-like Digimon named Kuwagamon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友よ! ワーガルルモン
WereGarurumon`s Diner [a.k.a. WereGarurumon`s Dinner]
Im Namen der Freundschaft
Un mauvais restaurant
Uvězněni v restauraci
Tomo yo! WereGarurumon
episode.summary: Matt, Gabumon, Joe, and Gomamon are being forced to work at Digitamamon`s diner to pay off a meal. DemiDevimon sets off a series of accidents that makes Matt question Joe`s friendship. Matt overcomes his feelings when Joe is willing to sacrifice himself to save T.K. Matt`s Crest glows and Garurumon digivolves into WereGarurumon and defeats Digitamamon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エンジェモン覚醒!
The Legend of the Digidestined
Die Legende der DigiRitter
Une vieille légende
Legenda o digivyvolených
Angemon Kakusei!
episode.summary: The entire group reunites and is attacked by Leomon. After Leomon is defeated with the light of the Digivices, he tells the children about the prophecies of the "DigiDestined." The group goes back to Infinity Mountain for the final showdown with Devimon. There, Devimon absorbs many Black Gears and grows in size and power—turning the fight in his favor until Patamon digivolves into Angemon and destroys him. Angemon, having used up so much power, reverts into a Digi-egg. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コロモン東京大激突!
Home Away From Home
Wieder zu Hause
Passage à la maison
Konečně doma
Koromon Tokyo Dai Gekitotsu!
episode.summary: Tai and Koromon meet with Kari in Tokyo. They discover that Digimon are appearing in the Real World and decide they must go back to the Digital World to help their friends. After Koromon digivolves into Agumon to battle an Ogremon, a portal opens back to the Digital World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二大究極進化! 闇をぶっとばせ!!
The Battle for Earth
Zusammentreffen zweier Welten
La sauvegarde de la Terre
Ni Daikyuukyoku Shinka! Yami o Buttobase!!
episode.summary: Agumon and Gabumon warp-digivolve into WarGreymon and MetalGarurumon. Even these two ultimate level digimon can`t defeat the more powerful than ever, VenomMyotismon. The digimon combine their attacks and the kids crests begin to glow, destroying VenomMyotismon. Just when the kids think their job is finished, they look up into the sky and see that the digiworld is up above them and up-side-down. They then realize that they must fix things in the DigitalWorld before things in the real world will return to normal. The kids make the hard decision to say goodbye to their parents. A rainbow then appears and pulls them back into the sky which is the Digital World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! 冷凍デジモン
Subzero Ice Punch!
Verschollen in Eis und Schnee
Coups de froid
Ledová pěst
Gekitotsu! Reitou Digimon
episode.summary: Tai and Agumon land on a snow-covered island and are forced to defeat a Frigimon. After destroying the Black Gear that was controlling him, they cross over to the island where Matt and Gabumon landed. Meanwhile, Matt goes out to search for his brother against Gabumon`s advice and gets hypothermia. Once the two boys meet up, they end up fighting each other until a Mojyamon attacks them. They defeat the Mojyamon and expel the Black Gear that was controlling him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 撃破! アトラーカブテリモン
No Questions, Please
Der Kampf um Izzys Wappen
Assez de questions
Izzy v nebezpečí
Gekiha! AtlurKabuterimon
episode.summary: Izzy is trapped in Vademon`s pocket dimension and robbed of his curiosity. Tentomon eventually reverts back to Pabumon, but manages to snap Izzy out of his trance. DemiDevimon attempts to buy Izzy`s Crest from Vademon and, in the confusion, Izzy recovers his Crest and his curiosity. Kabuterimon then digivolves into MegaKabuterimon and defeats Vademon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗黒進化! スカルグレイモン
The Arrival of Skullgreymon
Lektion für Taichi
Une mauvaise surprise
SkullGreymon
Ankoku Shinka! SkullGreymon
episode.summary: While traveling in the desert, Joe`s Tag reacts, leading the group into a Roman-like coliseum. There, they are trapped by Etemon, and Greymon is forced to fight another Greymon. After Joe finds his Crest of Reliability, the group escapes. Tai attempts to force Greymon to digivolve. Greymon digivolves into SkullGreymon and loses control of himself—attacking the others who are unable to stop him. SkullGreymon eventually reverts back to Koromon and apologizes for his behavior. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デジモン東京大横断!!
Almost Home Free
Heimkehr mit Hindernissen
Transports trop publics
Skoro doma
Digimon Tokyo Daioudan!!
episode.summary: The DigiDestined have a series of misadventures trying to get back to their homes in Odaiba. Eventually, they end up getting a ride from Sora`s cousin, Duane. Later, Duane accidentally pushes Izzy off a bridge. Gesomon attacks and is defeated by Ikkakumon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危険な遊戯! ピノッキモン
Playing Games
T.K. wird erwachsen
Jeux dangereux
Kiken na Yuugi! Pinocchimon
episode.summary: WarGreymon isn`t doing so well and is about to be destroyed. Just in time, Whamon jumps out of the water and takes the blast ment for WarGreymon. Whamon destroys MetalSeadramon using his own "River of Power". Whamon is destroyed. It isn`t long after that Puppetmon comes up with an evil plan to destroy the kids. He makes dolls of each of the kids and uses these to make them do what he wants them to. He then separates Matt and T.K. from everyone else. Kiwimon attacks the other kids while Puppetmon corners T.K. T.K. realizes what the dolls are used for and tricks Puppetmon and destroys the dolls. The Digimon easily defeat Kiwimon and Puppetmon says that no matter what it takes he will get revenge on T.K. Matt thinks that T.K. no longer needs him around, so he goes off somewhere by himself. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 輝く翼! ガルダモン
Sora`s Crest of Love
Im Zeichen der Liebe
Des signes d`amour
Sořin znak lásky
Kagayaku Tsubasa! Garudamon
episode.summary: The two groups reunite. Sora tells them about the meanings of each of their Crests and how DemiDevimon told her that her life was loveless and thus her Crest would never glow. Myotismon appears and easily defeats the Digimon. An injured Biyomon goes to help them and Sora`s concern and love causes her Crest to glow. Birdramon digivolves into Garudamon and helps the group escape. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出航(たびだち)・新大陸へ!
Departure For a New Continent
Abschied von der Insel
Un départ plein d`espoir
Cesta na nový světadíl
Tabidachi, Shin Tairiku e!
episode.summary: A mysterious person named Gennai appears as a hologram after a fight with Devimon and urges the group to travel to the continent of Server in order to defeat another enemy. Gennai also tells them about objects called Crests that will allow their Digimon to digivolve even further. They build a raft and leave File Island, but are soon swallowed up by Whamon who is still under the control of a Black Gear. After the gear is removed, Whamon takes the kids to where their Tags—the objects that the Crests are stored in—are hidden. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エテモン! 悪の花道
The Dark Network of Etemon
Das erste Wappen
Un réseau dangereux
Etemonova černá síť
Etemon! Aku no Hanamichi
episode.summary: The kids arrive in a Koromon village overrun with Pagumon, who trick the kids and kidnap Tokomon. Etemon learns of the arrival of the DigiDestined and confronts them. He uses his Dark Network to prevent the Digimon from digivolving and then traps the group inside a cave where they discover their first Crest, Tai`s Crest of Courage. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レアモン! 東京湾襲撃
The Eighth Digivice
Der achte DigiRitter
Le huitième Digivice
Osmý digiovladač
Raremon! Tokyo Wan Shuugeki
episode.summary: Tai thinks that Kari may be the eighth child, but he quicklly changes his mind when she doesn`t really seem to know much about the digimon. Tai`s cat Miko knocks a digivice out the window. That night, a digimon named Raremon shows up by the beach. While on his computer, Izzy gets an email from Gennai who tells him that he must go after this Digimon himself since everyone else is asleep. Suddenly, Izzy receives a singal from that eighth digivice. Izzy decides to look for the digivice while Tentomon goes after Raremon. Raremon is soon defeated, but a crow picks up the digivice and takes it back to its nest before Izzy is able to locate it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 冒険! パタモンと僕
DigiBaby Boom
DigiBaby Boom
Les bébés Digimon
Bouken! Patamon to Boku
episode.summary: T.K. and Patamon end up in Primary Village, the place where all Digimon are born. There they are confronted by Elecmon, the guardian of the baby Digimon. He struggles with Patamon, having mistaken the two for intruders. To avoid a fight, T.K. proposes that they settle their dispute with a tug-o-war. Patamon wins and earns Elecmon`s respect and trust. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: メタルエテモンの逆襲
Etemon`s Comeback Tour
Getrennte Wege
Le grand retour d`Etemon
MetalEtemon no Gyakushuu
episode.summary: The Woodmon are chasing Ogremon trying to catch him so they can take his digital data. Ogremon is then traped under a tree when a giant meteor slams into the ground. The Woodmon all run away and Joe and Mimi show up and help Ogremon. At first, Ogremon didn`t want their help, but over time he becomes their friend. The other kids find their way into Puppetmon`s house and begin to look around. However, outside the house Puppetmon finds Joe and Mimi, unlikely as it is, MetalEtemon shows up and saves them. Back inside the house, Tai and the other kids find two of Puppetmon`s guards. One of the guards leads them to a cannon that can be used against Puppetmon. Finally, as exspected, MetalEtomon turns on Joe and Mimi and chases them through the Jungle, but during the case something that looks like Leomon appears. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 躍る亡霊! バケモン
The Dancing Digimon
Tanz der Bakemon
Le Digimon dansant
Svátek Lorda Bakemona
Odoru Bourei! Bakemon
episode.summary: After suffering an attack from Ogremon at sea, Joe and Gomamon find themselves on an island with Sora and Biyomon. They are captured by a band of Bakemon intent on eating them. Gomamon and Biyomon manage to escape and digivolve to fight the Lord Bakemon. They eventually defeat him with help from Joe`s repetitive chanting. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守護者ケンタルモン!
A Clue From the Digi-Past
Das geheimnisvolle Labyrinth
Un indice venu du passé
Tajemství chrámu
Shugosha Kentarumon!
episode.summary: Mimi and Palmon are harassed by Sukamon and Chuumon. After escaping them, they cross over to the next island, where Izzy and Tentomon landed. After they reunite, Mimi and Tentomon get lost in a labyrinth and are attacked by Centarumon. Izzy and Palmon finally find them and their Digimon battle and destroy Centarumon`s Black Gear. After the battle, Leomon appears and attacks the children, but is driven back by the light of their Digivices. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パルモン怒りの進化!
Togemon in Toy Town
Der seltsame Bürgermeister
La ville de jouets
A Transformação de Palmon
Město hraček
Palmon Ikari no Shinka!
episode.summary: While escaping the Numemon who attacked the group in the sewers on their way out of the factory, the kids are split up and Mimi ends up in Toy Town after being attacked by a Monzaemon. There she finds the other kids acting strangely. Palmon manages to digivolve into Togemon and destroys the Black Gear that was controlling Monzaemon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 完全体総進撃! きらめくエンジェウーモン
Wizardmon`s Gift
Wizardmons Opfer
Le cadeau de Wizardmon
Dárek od Wizardmona
Kanzentai Sou Shingeki! Kirameku Angewomon
episode.summary: Kari has just given herself up to Myotismon. Meanwhile, the others are told that in order to defeat Myotismon they must return Kari`s tag and crest to her. Gatomon is tricked into telling Myotismon who the eighth child is. Myotismon gets Kari and nearly destroys her, but the other digimon show up just in time to save her. Myotismon makes an attack at Kari and Gatomon, but Wizardmon steps up and takes the full force of the blow and is killed by the blast. Tai gives Kari`s digivice to her and Gatomon digivolves into Angewomon. Angewomon strikes Myotismon with her "Celestial Arrow" and it seems that he is gone. However, the kids quickly learn that the battle is not over...The fog has still not lifted. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄の道化師ピエモン
The Crest of Friendship
Der Höllenclown
Vive l`amitié
Jigoku no Doukeshi Piemon
episode.summary: Joe and Gomamon are on a beach away from everything and everyone else, they start looking for Matt and after a while they do find his boat. Matt is now where around. Meanwhile, WarGreymon fights Piedmon but he needs the help of the other Digimon and fast. Matt thinks that he is not needed anymore and his fear creates a cave that he is soon lost in. Gabumon finally gets Matt to realize that he really is needed by the others and the cave soon disappears. Sora ends up in the same type of cave after finding Matt`s boat but not him..she becomes very depressed. The others find her and climb down in to save her. They help her to understand what she must do to make this cave disappear and soon she is free. Everyone then goes to help Tai in the battle against Piedmon. Gabumon gains more power after Matt realizes that he and Tai are better friends now than ever before. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻船長コカトリモン!
The Crest of Sincerity
Die Kaktusblüte
La force de la sincérité
Znak upřímnosti
Maboroshi Senchou Kokatorimon!
episode.summary: After getting lost in the desert, the group is taken aboard a ship helmed by Kokatorimon. Kokatorimon captures all the boys and their partners. Biyomon and Palmon digivolve and defeat him when his ship crashes into a giant cactus. The top of cactus then opens up to reveal Mimi`s Crest of Sincerity. Source: crunchyroll
